name: Weird Wood (JackBruxner)
description:
(1-4 Players, co-op highly recommended)
- requires controller(s)

Weird Wood is where 90’s subculture meets zany “Scooby Doo” antics, as you and your friends hunt through an abandoned nature park, looking for parts to repair your vehicle before you're hunted down by what lurks in the shadows..

Produced over 4 months with a team of 5, Weird Wood was created as a student prototype as part of the Games Program at RMIT University.  Focused on clean 90’s inspired pixel aesthetics and old fashioned local co-operative gameplay, Weird Wood is a homage to a decade we felt was criminally under-represented in the world of games.

Developed by:
Jack Bruxner
Ben Turner
Ruairi Daws
Lily Harrison
Alexander Ong
